title: Is there any reason why Cassiopeia has more base armor than most melee champions?
body:
At level 18 she has 90 armor. Just to put that into perspective here's some melee champs' armor at level 18

Olaf has 77
Trundle has 73
Jax has 78
Master Yi has 75
Kassadin has 77

And don't say "but some of those champions have giant armor steroids" yea, and Cassiopeia is ranged. Giving Jax/Olaf 500 range and removing their defensive steroids would be a MASSIVE buff to them. If you're telling me that a hero with ranged waveclear and poke and a better laning phase than all the champions I listed also deserves way higher base armor then you're kidding yourselves

I already gave an argument for this

So the fact that Cass gets range and higher armor makes no sense

But they _DO _ have armor steroids and they don't have 500 range, and this is what they are balanced around.

Cassiopeia is a DPS mage who loses the ability to DPS if she mistimes a spell or misses a skillshot so it's not surprising she gets <1 point of armor more per level than other champions for a slight bit of protection for when she's rendered temporarily useless.
She further still has the same relatively low level of base armor for champions like her anyway.
{{champion:16}} has higher base armor and her armor per level is only .2 less than Cassiopeia.


On the other hand Jax and Olaf are champions with consistent high damage potential, armor steroids, and can become quite oppressive if ahead.  

Especially Olaf.
Olaf's base numbers are deliberately kept a bit weaker than average because his kit is broken in parts. Because if he gets ahead, he has the ability to steamroll through the entire enemy team and chop chop the enemy carries all while lifestealing back the damage he takes, a capability which gets **stronger** the more enemies try to bring him down.

So there is plenty of sensible reasons why Cassiopeia's armor per level is where it is at.

that doesn't take away the point that giving them 500 range and taking away their armor steroids would be a giant buff to them. 

You can't balance one set of champions around a lower standard and then call them fine when comparing them to another champ that is balanced around a higher standard. Olaf has fairly high level 1 armor (26) and his passive armor steroid. This set-up exists to pronounce the trade-off in his ult: As he loses the passive resistance bonus, he becomes more squishy during Ragnarok's effect. However, at that point, straight-up killing him is the next-to only option you have to deal with him - he ignores all CC except artificial terrain, runs at you with a significant MS boost (possibly even Ghost and Glory) and chops you down with the 2880 gold of bonus AD he gets.

Cassiopeia retains her base Armor for two possible reasons:
1. They never thought about nerfing her in that regard.
2. She's a rather close-ranged mage, and thus has to get near the thick of things to get the job done. However, it is rather difficult for her to itemize armor, as Zhonya's is a rather poor item for her - she's a DPS mage and can't really afford to spend 2.5 seconds in stasis in a fight (in this season of OGN, it stands 7-4 for Cassiopeias not having Zhonya's at game's end vs having it).

However, you're right in that regard: Does Cass really need THAT high an Armor growth factor?

The champions you listed either have mobility (Jax, Kass, Yi), MS steroids (Yi, Trundle), defensive steroids/heals/shields, or a combination of the above. Riot's stance on having a steroid is that your base *insert stat* should be lower than average so that you aren't "overboard". For instance, Graves' shit AS is because he has an AS steroid, Riven has low HP regen because she has a shield, etc.

Before she received a round of nerfs to her W, pre-rework Sona had **the lowest HP and armor in the game.** Lower than Anivia who has 2 lives, lower than Lux who has insane range, lower even than lane creeps. Without runes, masteries, or the use of abilities, Sona would've lost a lvl 1 encounter to a lane creep. Her AD was nerfed too at some point if I remember well. The reason behind that? "Well the auras give her free stats so her base stats must be lowered so that she doesn't have an unfair advantage." Mk. What's the point of even having a steroid?

First off, you can't compare ONE stat between champions without comparing the rest, especially if you admit you're going to ignore the giant armor steroids.

Cass has slightly more base armor, sustain, and cc built into her kit. 

Trundle has sustain, cc, a sustain/healing steroid, and steals health and resistances (BOTH lowering the enemy's defenses and raising his, instead of one or the other, justifies slightly lower base armor).

Jax dodges basic attacks with one spell, takes less damage from aoe spells with the same spell, and has a defensive steroid. Mostly seems like a glass cannon until he activates these defensive steroids.

Kassadin takes 15% less damage from magic damage. I have no idea why you're complaining he has lower base armor than Cass.

Olaf has sustain and defensive steroids.

All those champions have some form of sustain or defensive steroid in their kit, justifying slightly lower base defenses that doesn't matter when they're full build. It's like arguing why Cass doesn't stack AP like Veigar does because of her passive AP steroid.

I would surmise that high base armor is because Cassiopeia's kit demands she get right on her opponents ass and stay there spamming Fangs. She's built to favor prolonged stays in enemy range, so she has higher base armor than some others.

Also most of the characters you listed build Armor as part of their standard build, mages won't always do that. So their armor is tuned with the expectation that they will also be buying armor items.

That's not just Cassiopeia, though. Basically, before stats were "Standardized" or something of the sort late s4/early s5, base stats were pretty much tinkering tools. For example, if Riot suspected a champion to be a little underpowered/overpowered, they adjusted base stats accordingly to compensate. On release, Cassiopeia WAS underpowered, however slightly, and maybe they foresaw that and gave her an unusually high amount of base armor. Of course, they still do that now, despite it being an ever so meaningless way to deal with broken mechanics. (Lowering Kat's health and regen's not going to stop her bullshit resets, lowering Riven's regen and health isn't going to stop her level 2 cheese, at least in a good and meaningful way, and lowering Ekko's movespeed isn't going to change his overloaded, finnicky kit)

Or, it could just be the way the cookie crumbles and they gave her 90 base armor on a whim. Miss Fortune's got  more base health than Shen, a huge amount of health despite being ranged, as does Kayle. Kayle in general Has melee base stats despite her might as well being ranged. Skarner's got 125+ base AD just because.

It may be a reason to say "fuck Cassiopeia," I'll give you that, but it's her shoddy rework that amplified rather than subdued the frustrating elements of her kit that puts her on everyone's hate list IMO.
